param.desc: Names the output file organization strategy to use for generated files. One of the pre-defined strategies or a user-implemented name. If the strategy name is not recognized (that is, not handled by the base code or an extension) then the default strategy is applied. The default is dependent on the specific transformation type. For HTML2 the default is "as-authored". For EPUB it is "single-dir".
param.name: html2.file.organization.strategy

All links are included.

val.desc: Fail quickly if files are going to be generated or copied outside of the directory.
Complete the operation if files will be generated or copied outside of the directory, but log a warning.
Quietly finish without generating warnings or errors.

Disables generation of debugging attributes

param.desc: Specifies how the DITA-OT handles errors and error recovery.

val.desc: When an error is encountered, the DITA-OT stops processing
When an error is encountered, the DITA-OT attempts to recover from it
When an error is encountered, the DITA-OT continues processing but does not attempt error recovery

param.desc: The URL of a remote file or the file path of a local file that contains the logo image that will be added in the header area.
param.name: webhelp.logo.image

param.desc: The URL of the link that will be opened when the user clicks the logo image.

param.desc: If this parameter is set to false, then the 5-star rating mechanism is no longer included in the search results that are displayed on the Search tab (default setting is true).
param.name: webhelp.search.ranking

param.desc: Include footer in each Webhelp page
param.name: webhelp.footer.include

val.desc: If the "webhelp.footer.file" parameter has a value, the content of that file is used as footer. If "webhelp.footer.file" has no value, the default Oxygen footer is inserted in each Webhelp page.
No footer is added to the Webhelp pages.

param.desc: Specifies the location of a well-formed XHTML file that contains your custom footer for the document body. Corresponds to the WEBHELP_FOOTER_FILE parameter in XSLT. The fragment must be well-formed XHTML, with a single root element. Common practice is to place all content into a <div>.
param.name: webhelp.footer.file

param.desc: Specifies the URL of a well-formed XHTML document whose content will be copied into the <head> element of your output HTML documents.
param.name: webhelp.head.script

param.desc: Specifies the URL of a well-formed XHTML document whose content will be copied into the <body> element of your output HTML documents.
param.name: webhelp.body.script

param.desc: DEPRECATED: Use webhelp.head.script instead.
param.name: args.hdf

param.desc: DEPRECATED: Use webhelp.body.script instead.
param.name: args.hdr

param.desc: The URL of a remote PHP or CGI script where the publisher of the WebHelp output will receive the user ratings.
param.name: custom.rate.page.url

param.desc: The copyright note that will be added in the footer of the Table of Contents frame (the left side frame of the WebHelp output).
param.name: webhelp.copyright

param.desc: Specifies an identifier of the current documentation project. This is needed when multiple WebHelp systems are deployed on the same server. For example, "mobile-phone-user-guide" or "hvac-installation-guide"
param.name: webhelp.product.id

param.desc: Specifies the documentation version number (for example, 1.0, 2.5, etc.). New user comments are bound to this version. Multiple documentation versions can be deployed on the same server.
param.name: webhelp.product.version

param.desc: Include footer in each Webhelp page
param.name: webhelp.footer.include

val.desc: If the "webhelp.footer.file" parameter has a value, the content of that file is used as footer. If "webhelp.footer.file" has no value, the default Oxygen footer is inserted in each Webhelp page.
No footer is added to the Webhelp pages.

param.desc: Specifies the location of a well-formed XHTML file that contains your custom footer for the document body. Corresponds to the WEBHELP_FOOTER_FILE parameter in XSLT. The fragment must be well-formed XHTML, with a single root element. Common practice is to place all content into a <div>.
param.name: webhelp.footer.file

param.desc: Path to the Prince executable file (eg: "c:\path\to\prince.exe" on Windows) which should be run to produce the PDF
param.name: css.processor.path.prince

param.desc: Path to the Antenna House executable file (eg: "c:\path\to\AHFCmd.exe" on Windows) which should be run to produce the PDF
param.name: css.processor.path.antenna-house

param.desc: Choose the formatting processor.
param.name: css.processor.type

param.desc: You can use this to specify a list of CSS URLs to be used by the PDF processor. The files must have URL syntax and be separated using semicolons. If the value is empty, then the DITA topics/maps CSS files (currently selected from the oXygen [Styles] dropdown) are used.
param.name: dita.css.list

param.desc: You can use this to specify a list of CSS URLs to be used in addition to the dita.css.list parameter. The files must have URL syntax and be separated using semicolons.
param.name: args.css

param.desc: When set on 'yes', the user comments, colored highlights and trackchanges are shown in the output.
param.name: show.changes.and.comments

param.desc: The file path to a directory that contains resources files. All files from this directory will be copied to the root of the WebHelp output.
param.name: webhelp.custom.resources

param.desc: The file path of an image used as favicon.
param.name: webhelp.favicon

param.desc: Specifies the location of a well-formed XHTML file that contains the Custom Search Engine script from Google. The value must be a file path.
param.name: webhelp.google.search.script

param.desc: Specifies the location of a well-formed XHTML file that contains the Google Custom Search Engine element "gcse:searchresults-only". The value must be a file path. You can use all supported attributes for this element. It is recommended to set the "linkTarget" attribute value to "frm" for frameless (iframe) versions of WebHelp, or to "contentWin" for frameset versions of WebHelp. The default value for this attribute is "_blank" and the search results will be loaded in a new window. If this parameter is not specified, the following code will be used: <gcse:searchresults-only linkTarget="frm"></gcse:searchresults-only>
param.name: webhelp.google.search.results

param.desc: Enables the display for header links of the following types: Parent Topic, Next Topic, Previous Topic.
param.name: args.hide.parent.link

param.desc: Specifies if stemming is used when searching in WebHelp generated content.
param.name: use.stemming

param.desc: The value of the "priority" element in the generated sitemap.xml file. Possible value is any fractional number between 0.0 (least important priority) and 1.0 (most important priority). For example: 0.3, 0.5, 0.8, etc. The "priority" element is optional in the sitemap.xml. If you leave this parameter set to its default empty value, the priority element is not added in sitemap.xml.
param.name: webhelp.sitemap.priority

param.desc: The value of the "changefreq" element in the generated sitemap.xml file. The "changefreq" element is optional in the sitemap.xml file. If you leave this parameter set to its default empty value, the changefreq element is not added in sitemap.xml.
param.name: webhelp.sitemap.change.frequency

param.desc: File path of the user dictionary that will be used by the Kuromoji indexer for indexing Japanese content in the WebHelp pages.
param.name: webhelp.search.japanese.dictionary

param.desc: Base URL for all the "loc" elements in the generated sitemap.xml file. The value of a "loc" element is composed of the value of the base URL parameter, followed by the value of the href attributes of the topicref elements (a relative file path). The "loc" element is mandatory in the sitemap.xml file. If you leave this parameter set to its default empty value, the sitemap.xml file is not generated.
param.name: webhelp.sitemap.base.url

param.desc: Specifies the language of the UI items displayed (such as labels or buttons) in the WebHelp output.
param.name: args.default.language

param.desc: Set this parameter if you have out of memory problems generating WebHelp. It will increase processing time but decrease the memory footprint.
param.name: webhelp.reload.stylesheet

param.desc: When set on 'yes', the user comments, colored highlights and trackchanges are shown in the output.
param.name: webhelp.show.changes.and.comments

param.desc: The path of the file that contains name patterns for HTML files that should not be indexed by the WebHelp search engine. Each line of this file is taken to be an exclude pattern. The patterns are considered relative paths, relative to the output directory. '*' matches zero or more characters, '?' matches one character. You can read more about patterns here: https://ant.apache.org/manual/dirtasks.html#patterns
param.name: webhelp.search.custom.excludes.file

param.desc: Specifies the XSL processor.
param.name: pdf.formatter

val.desc: Antenna House Formatter

param.desc: Specifies whether draft-comment and required-cleanup elements are included in the output.
param.name: publish.required.cleanup

param.desc: Specifies the user configuration file for Antenna House Formatter.
param.name: axf.opt

param.desc: Specifies the path to the Antenna House Formatter executable.
param.name: axf.cmd

param.desc: Specifies the directory within the EPUB to hold CSS files. Value should be a relative path, e.g. 'css'.
param.name: args.csspath

param.desc: Specifies the absolute or relative path of the graphic to use as the cover graphic for the EPUB. An absolute, platform-specific filename or a path relative to the root map to a JPG, PNG, or GIF to use as the cover graphic.
param.name: cover.graphic.file

param.desc: Specifies the maximum depth of the navigation table of contents. The default is the value of the d4p.max.toc.depth parameter, which itself defaults to "5".
param.name: d4p.max.nav.depth

param.desc: Specifies the maximum depth of the generated HTML table of contents.
param.name: d4p.max.toc.depth

param.desc: Specifies the name of the directory within the EPUB to hold all the topics.
param.name: topics.output.dir

param.desc: Turns on exclusion of auto-generated related links (as for normal HTML output) Controls base Toolkit processing by turning off the maplink-check and maplink targets, which has the effect of eliminating auto-generated related links. Note that explicitly-authored related links are not affected. This property cannot be set to true by default because it is a global property that affects all transformation types. You must set this property explicitly in order to suppress related links in the output.
param.name: epub.exclude.auto.rellinks

val.desc: related links are generated

param.desc: Specifies the URI prefix stub to use in constructing the full EPUB ID value in the EPUB metadata. Any valid URI string. If this is a relative URI it should end with a "/" character. This parameter should normally reflect the organization that owns or publishes the EPUB, e.g., "http://mydomain.com/EPUB" or something similar.
param.name: epub.pubid.uri.stub

param.desc: Specifies the directory to use for EPUB-specific processing separate from the main Toolkit"s temp directory. An absolute platform-specific filename. This directory holds all the files that are then Zipped up to create the final EPUB file. By default temporary EPUB files are stored in a directory called "epub_temp" within the defined Toolkit temp directory.
param.name: epub.temp.dir

param.desc: Specifies the name of the directory within the EPUB to hold all images. Any valid directory name. The EPUB process automatically renames graphics to ensure that there are no name conflicts when the graphics are copied to into this directory from their source locations.
param.name: images.output.dir

param.desc: Specifies the type of EPUB to produce: EPUB 2 only, EPUB3 only, or Dual EPUB 2/3. Default is dual 2/3.
param.name: d4p.epubtype

param.desc: The URI of the EPUB font manifest file. The font manifest specifies the fonts to embed in the EPUB.
param.name: epub.font.manifest

param.desc: Indicates whether or not to apply font obfuscation to fonts flagged as obfuscated in the font manifest.
param.name: epub.obfuscate.fonts

param.desc: The path, within the generated EPUB, to store embedded fonts. Default is 'fonts'.
param.name: epub.fonts.output.dir

param.desc: Indicates whether or not to generate CSS @font-face rules for embedded fonts as configurated in the font manifest. Default 'false' (don't generate CSS rules)
param.name: epub.generate.css.font.rules

param.desc: The @class value to use for generated title-only topics, e.g., '- topic/topic concept/concept '
param.name: title.only.topic.class.spec

param.desc: The @class value to use for generated title-only topic titles, e.g., '- topic/title '
param.name: title.only.topic.title.class.spec

param.desc: Indicates whether or not to generate an HTML table of contents in addition to the required navigation ToC (EPUB 2 .ncx file or EPUB 3 nav element)
param.name: epub.generate.html.toc

param.desc: Set to 'false' to prevent copying of the built-in CSS files. By default the normal OT-provided CSS files are copied into the EPUB.
param.name: epub.copy.system.css

param.desc: Specifies JavaScript file to include in all generated HTML Files
param.name: epub.javascript.file

param.desc: Specifies directory withih EPUB to put included JavaScript
param.name: epub.javascript.dir

param.desc: Specifies whether or not to generate a back-of-the-book index
param.name: html2.generate.index

param.desc: Determines whether images are embedded as binary objects within the ODT file.
param.name: args.odt.img.embed

param.desc: Specifies if the breadcrumb component will be presented in the Webhelp Responsive output.

param.desc: Specifies if the navigation links component will be presented in the Webhelp Responsive output.
param.name: webhelp.show.navigation.links

param.desc: Specifies if the link to the index terms will be presented in the Webhelp Responsive output.

param.name: webhelp.show.side.toc

param.name: webhelp.side.toc.links

val.desc: The Side TOC will include only the links to the current topic and its children.
The Side TOC will include the links to the current topic, its children, and its ancestors.
The Side TOC will include all links.

param.desc: Specifies if the top menu component will be presented in the Webhelp Responsive output.
param.name: webhelp.show.top.menu

param.desc: Specifies if the related links component will be presented in the Webhelp Responsive output.
param.name: webhelp.show.related.links

param.desc: Specifies if the related links from the nested topics of will be merged with the links in the parent topic. Thus the links will be moved from the topic content to the related links component.
param.name: webhelp.merge.nested.topics.related.links

param.desc: Specifies if the child links component will be presented in the Webhelp Responsive output.
param.name: webhelp.show.child.links

param.desc: Specifies if the toggle highlights component will be presented in the Webhelp Responsive output.
param.name: webhelp.show.toggle.highlights

param.desc: Specifies the path to the HTML file that contains the content for the WebHelp footer. It can also be an XML fragment.
param.name: webhelp.fragment.footer
param.val: Generated by <oXygen/> XML WebHelp

param.desc: Specifies the path to the HTML file that contains the content to be included before the WebHelp logo and title. It can also be an XML fragment.
param.name: webhelp.fragment.before.logo_and_title

param.desc: Specifies the path to the HTML file that contains the content to be included after the WebHelp logo and title. It can also be an XML fragment.
param.name: webhelp.fragment.after.logo_and_title

param.desc: Specifies the path to the HTML file that contains the content to be included before the WebHelp top menu. It can also be an XML fragment.
param.name: webhelp.fragment.before.top_menu

param.desc: Specifies the path to the HTML file that contains the content to be included after the WebHelp top menu. It can also be an XML fragment.
param.name: webhelp.fragment.after.top_menu

param.desc: Specifies the path to the HTML file that contains the content to be included in the html 'head' element of the WebHelp pages. It can also be an XML fragment.
param.name: webhelp.fragment.head

param.desc: Specifies the path to the HTML file that contains the content to be included at the beginning of the html 'body' element of the WebHelp pages. It can also be an XML fragment.
param.name: webhelp.fragment.before.body

param.desc: Specifies the path to the HTML file that contains the content to be included at the end of the html 'body' element of the WebHelp pages. It can also be an XML fragment.
param.name: webhelp.fragment.after.body

param.desc: Specifies the path to the HTML file that contains the content to be included before the WebHelp main page search component. It can also be an XML fragment.
param.name: webhelp.fragment.before.main.page.search

param.desc: Specifies the path to the HTML file that contains the content to be included after the WebHelp main page search component. It can also be an XML fragment.
param.name: webhelp.fragment.after.main.page.search

param.desc: Specifies the path to the HTML file that contains the content to be included before the WebHelp main page TOC or tiles component. It can also be an XML fragment.
param.name: webhelp.fragment.before.toc_or_tiles

param.desc: Specifies the path to the HTML file that contains the content to be included after the WebHelp main page TOC or tiles component. It can also be an XML fragment.
param.name: webhelp.fragment.after.toc_or_tiles

param.desc: Specifies if autocomplete feature is enabled in the WebHelp search text field.
param.name: webhelp.enable.search.autocomplete

param.desc: Specifies the tooltip position relative to the current topic in the Side TOC.
param.name: webhelp.side.toc.tooltip.position

param.desc: DEPRECATED: Use webhelp.fragment.head instead.
param.name: args.hdf

param.desc: DEPRECATED: Use webhelp.fragment.before.body instead.
param.name: args.hdr

param.desc: Specifies if search result items will be displayed on multiple pages or not.
param.name: webhelp.search.enable.pagination

param.desc: Specifies the number of search results items displayed on each page. This parameter is used only when the 'webhelp.search.enable.pagination' parameter is enabled.
param.name: webhelp.search.page.numberOfItems

param.desc: Specifies if the 'sequence' value will be used by default when the collection-type attribute is not specified. This option is helpful if you want to have 'Next' and 'Previous' navigational buttons generated for all HTML pages.
param.name: webhelp.default.collection.type.sequence

param.desc: Specifies the name of the ditamap file for a JavaHelp project.
param.name: args.javahelp.map

param.desc: Specifies the name of the file containing the TOC in your JavaHelp output.
param.name: args.javahelp.toc

transtype.desc: Export DITA Map contents to ZIP archive
transtype.name: exportmap

param.desc: Show Oxygen track changes and comments
param.name: show.changes.and.comments

param.desc: Specifies the name of a file that you want included in the HTML Help.
param.name: args.htmlhelp.includefile

param.desc: The path of the default topic that will be opened the first time in the CHM output, relative to the base output directory (for example: topics\\intro.html).
param.name: args.htmlhelp.default.topic

param.desc: Global encoding for CHM output pages.
param.name: htmlhelp.locale

param.desc: Specifies whether to generate a label for each image; the label will contain the image file name.
param.name: args.artlbl

param.desc: Specifies whether to copy the custom .css file to the output directory.
param.name: args.copycss

param.desc: Specifies the name of a custom .css file.
param.name: args.css

param.desc: Specifies the location of a copied .css file relative to the output directory.
param.name: args.csspath

param.desc: Specifies the directory that contains the custom .css file.
param.name: args.cssroot

param.desc: Specifies the language locale file to use for sorting index entries.
param.name: args.dita.locale

param.desc: Specifies an XML file that contains content for a running footer.
param.name: args.ftr

param.desc: Specifies whether to generate extra metadata that targets parental control scanners, meta elements with name="security" and name="Robots".
param.name: args.gen.default.meta

param.desc: Specifies an XML file that contains content to be placed in the document head.
param.name: args.hdf

param.desc: Specifies an XML file that contains content for a running header.
param.name: args.hdr

param.desc: Specifies whether to hide links to parent topics in the HTML5 output.
param.name: args.hide.parent.link

param.desc: Specifies whether to include the DITA class ancestry inside the HTML5 elements.
param.name: args.html5.classattr

param.desc: Specifies the value of the @target attribute on the <base> element in the TOC file.
param.name: args.html5.contenttarget

param.desc: Specifies the base name of the TOC file.
param.name: args.html5.toc

param.desc: Specifies the value of the @class attribute on the <body> element in the TOC file.
param.name: args.html5.toc.class

param.desc: Specifies a custom XSL file to be used for TOC generation.
param.name: args.html5.toc.xsl

param.desc: Specifies whether the content of <indexterm> elements are rendered in the output.
param.name: args.indexshow

param.desc: Specifies the file extension for HTML5 output.
param.name: args.outext

param.desc: Specifies a custom XSL file to be used instead of the default XSL transformation.
param.name: args.xsl

param.desc: Specifies whether to generate a navigation TOC in topic pages.
param.name: nav-toc

val.desc: No TOC
Partial TOC that shows the current topic
Full TOC

param.desc: Specifies if custom images will be used when generating PDF output with the 'pdf2' transtype. Set this parameter to 'no' to use the default images from the PDF2 plugin or your custom images.
param.name: com.oxygenxml.use.custom.note.images

param.desc: Specifies whether or not to generate a dynamic TOC in the output.
param.name: html2.generate.dynamic.toc

param.desc: Specifies whether or not to generate an HTML frameset file for the map.
param.name: html2.generate.frameset

param.desc: Specifies whether or not to generate a back-of-the-book index
param.name: html2.generate.index

param.desc: Specifies whether or not to generate a static TOC in the output
param.name: html2.generate.static.toc

param.desc: DOCX template file
param.name: dotx.file

param.name: document.flat.xsl

param.desc: Core metadata stylesheet
param.name: core.xsl

param.name: custom.xsl

param.desc: Main document stylesheet
param.name: document.xsl

param.desc: Comments stylesheet
param.name: comments.xsl

param.name: numbering.xsl

param.name: footnotes.xsl
